elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions on the subject of market failure.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: How does a monopoly differ from an oligopoly?
elements.correctAnswer: In a monopoly, a single supplier faces many buyers. In an oligopoly, there are a few (at least two) suppliers facing many customers.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Why are monopolies harmful?
elements.correctAnswer: Due to the lack of competition, monopolists can sell their products at a price that is higher than the market price. This allows them to make a high profit at the expense of consumers. There is also a risk that monopolies are less innovative and neglect research and development, as their products are not threatened by competing products.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Explain the term "public goods" in one sentence.
elements.correctAnswer: Public goods are goods that no one can be excluded from using.
